greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} d^2*A000593(n/d).
comment: Multiplicative because this sequence is the Dirichlet convolution of A000290 and A000593 which are both multiplicative. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 27 2018
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: L.g.f.: log(Product_{k>=1} (1 + x^k)^sigma(k)) = Sum_{n>=1} a(n)*x^n/n. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jun 19 2018
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d^2*sigma(d>>valuation(d, 2))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 03 2017
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jun 09 2017
